'''Camerupt''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''バクーダ''' ''Bakuuda'') is a dual-type {{2t|Fire|Ground}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s from {{p|Numel}} starting at [[level]] 33. It can [[Mega Evolution|Mega Evolve]] into '''Mega Camerupt''' using the [[Cameruptite‎]].

==Biology==
Camerupt is a quadruped Pokémon that resembles a {{wp|Bactrian camel}}. It has two gray volcanoes on its back. The two volcanoes on a female's back are bigger than those on a male. It also has a stout body with red shaggy fur and three blue ring-shaped markings on both sides. It has bangs on top of its head, droopy ears, and a tan furless muzzle.

As Mega Camerupt, the humps on its back have transformed into one large and very active volcano. Its fur expands and grows to a point where only its hooves can be seen, and its ears and the tufts on its head grow thicker and longer, standing on end. It gains a grey M on the front of its face and loses the three blue rings on its body. Magma is constantly bubbling up from within its body. It has a deep hatred of water or any moisture, and has an explosive personality and a short temper. The volcano on its back erupts constantly in an effort to intimidate its foes.<ref name= "Mega">http://www.pokemonrubysapphire.com/en-us/pokemon/new-mega-evolutions/mega-camerupt</ref>

Its body contains amounts of molten lava of 18,000&nbsp;°F (10,000&nbsp;°C), which erupts out of its humps if the Pokémon is angered. As shown [[AG046|in the anime]], it can become uncontrollably angry when it is struck in the face. It lives in the {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Mountain Pokémon|craters of volcanoes}}.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Xatu Forest Camerupt.png|thumb|250px|left|Camerupt in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
Camerupt made its main series debut in ''[[AG046|Candid Camerupt!]]''. [[Winstrate family|Vicky Winstrate]] used the Eruption Pokémon to battle [[Ash's Pikachu]]. Once Pikachu struck Vicky's Camerupt on the nose with {{m|Iron Tail}}, Camerupt went on an {{m|Eruption}} rampage. Vito's {{p|Alakazam}} used {{m|Rain Dance}} in order to stop Camerupt before it could reach the Winstrate's vegetable patch.

In ''[[AG086|Lights, Camerupt, Action!]]'', a man named [[Elijah]] was using a Camerupt to help carry his film-making equipment.

A Camerupt attacked {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}} in ''[[DP140|Historical Mystery Tour!]]''

A Camerupt that can Mega Evolve appeared in ''[[M19|Volcanion and the Mechanical Marvel]]'', under the control of [[Levi]] and [[Cherie]]'s Mega Wave. Camerupt was used to battled against [[Ash's Noivern]] and {{AP|Greninja}}. It was later freed from their control when [[Alva]]'s Mega Wave Crystal was destroyed, and it escaped.

====Minor appearances====
Camerupt debuted appearing in the opening sequence of ''[[M06|Jirachi: Wish Maker]]''.

A Camerupt was one of {{FB|Factory Head|Noland}}'s Pokémon in ''[[AG135|Numero Uno Articuno]]''.

Camerupt made a cameo appearance in ''[[DP091|One Team, Two Team, Red Team, Blue Team!]]''

A Camerupt appeared in ''[[DP171|Dawn of a Royal Day!]]'', under the ownership of a [[Pokémon Coordinator]] competing in the {{to|Arrowroot}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

A Camerupt appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M13|Zoroark: Master of Illusions]]''.

A Camerupt that can [[Mega Evolution|Mega Evolve]] into Mega Camerupt appeared in ''[[SS031|Mega Evolution Special II]]''.

===In the Pokémon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire Animated Trailer===
A [[Mega Evolution|Mega]] Camerupt made a cameo appearance in the [[Pokémon Omega Ruby and Pokémon Alpha Sapphire Animated Trailer]].

===In Pokémon Generations===
A Camerupt appeared in ''[[PG07|The Vision]]'', under the ownership of {{FB|Magma Admin|Courtney}}. It was sent out by its {{pkmn|Trainer}} to battle {{ga|Brendan}}'s {{p|Sceptile}}.
{{-}}

==In the manga==
[[File:Maxie Camerupt Adventures.png|thumb|180px|Camerupt in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
[[File:Maxie Mega Camerupt Adventures.png|thumb|left|180px|Mega Camerupt in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Ash & Pikachu manga===
Vicky of the [[Winstrate family]] owns a Camerupt similar to the anime.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
[[Maxie]] has a Camerupt that he used in his battles against his rival leader [[Archie]] and later {{adv|Ruby}} and {{adv|Sapphire}}. He was later seen in the {{chap|Omega Ruby & Alpha Sapphire}}s where he [[Mega Evolution|Mega Evolved]] into Mega Camerupt. After Maxie disappeared he was taken by [[Blaise]]. He first appeared in ''[[PS200|Tripped Up by Torkoal]]''.

A Camerupt was one of {{adv|Ruby}}'s opponents in the Normal Rank Beauty Contest in [[Verdanturf Town]] in ''[[PS217|Mind-Boggling with Medicham]]''.

In ''[[PS422|Interrupting Ivysaur]]'', a Camerupt under the ownership of a {{tc|Veteran}} named Beck appeared during {{adv|Platinum}}'s challenge at the Battle Arcade.

A Camerupt appeared in ''[[PAXY30|Pinsir Changes]]''.
{{-}}

==Trivia==
* Camerupt's Pokédex entries for {{v2|Emerald}}, {{game3|HeartGold and SoulSilver|HeartGold, and SoulSilver|s}} say that the volcanoes on its back erupt every 10 years. However, its entries from {{game3|Ruby and Sapphire|Sapphire,|s}} {{game3|FireRed and LeafGreen|FireRed, and LeafGreen|s}}, as well as dialogue from the Mystery Dungeon series, claim that they erupt whenever it is angry, which is also shown in the {{pkmn|anime}}.
* Camerupt's evolutionary line can be seen as a parallel to {{p|Sharpedo}}'s family. Both of them are dual-type Pokémon, both lines have identical base stat totals per evolutionary stage, both of their final evolutions are used by [[Team Magma]] Leader [[Maxie]] and [[Team Aqua]] Leader [[Archie]], respectively, and both of their final evolutions can [[Mega Evolution|Mega Evolve]].
* Mega Camerupt is tied with {{p|Slugma}}, {{p|Torkoal}}, and {{p|Litwick}} for having the lowest base Speed stat of all {{type|Fire}} Pokémon.

===Origin===
Camerupt is essentially a {{wp|Bactrian camel}} with volcanoes on its back instead of humps.

====Name origin====
Camerupt is a combination of ''{{wp|camel}}'' and ''erupt''.

Bakuuda is a combination of 爆弾 ''bakudan'' ({{wp|bomb}}) or 爆発 ''bakuhatsu'' (explosion or eruption) and 駱駝 ''rakuda'' (camel). ''Baku'' may also derive from ''{{wp|Bactrian camel}}s'' (camels with two humps).
